info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 19 at 7:03PM CDT until April 19 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Central Ward County in western Texas... Southeastern Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Presidio County in southwestern Texas...
* Until 830 PM CDT.
* At 702 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Toyah to near Marfa Municipal Airport to 9 miles south of Candelaria, moving southeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph.
SOURCE...Emergency management reports of less than one-quarter mile visibility in Culberson County at 659 PM CDT.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 186 and 245. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 30.
Locations impacted include... Toyah Lake, Star Mountain, Balmorhea, Elephant Mountain Wildlife Management Area, Presidio Lely International Airport, Fort Davis, Marfa, McDonald Observatory, Toyahvale, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp, Saragosa, Fort Davis National Historical Site, Black Mountain, Shafter, Ruidosa, Coyanosa, Chinati Mountains, Alpine, Alpine-Casparis Municipal Airport, and Davis Mountains State Park.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 8:30 PM CDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 8:30 PM CDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Brewster, TX; Jeff Davis, TX; Pecos, TX; Presidio, TX; Reeves, TX; Ward, TX

There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 8:30 PM CDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 8:30 PM CDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.
